page.title: 05TOURISM IN HERNE BAY
page.content: As people's holiday habits have changed so the nature of Herne Bay's tourist industry has also changed. No longer do rows of boarding houses cater for a vast influx of holiday makers every summer. Certainly many houses along the front do still cater for the Bed and Breakfast holiday and in many cases it is the older people who would still stay at Herne Bay for a quiet holiday. The bulk of the holiday trade in 1985 would be from fairly local people taking advantage of the odd sunny day to visit the beaches. Although the beaches are stoney and the water is very shallow when the tide is out at least the swimming is very safe and there are two wooden diving boards for use at high tide.
